metadata.title: Improving Maritime Transport Sustainability Using Blockchain-Based Information Exchange

introduction.preview: [PAGE 1] 1. Introduction [PAGE 1] The shipping industry is still a traditionally oriented industry, despite numerous technological [PAGE 1] revolutions [ 1 ]. [PAGE 1] The companies in the maritime transport sector are facing notable challenges [PAGE 1] resulting from the emergence of disruptive technologies, for example, the lack of regulation and [PAGE 1] the issues of security and privacy. Nevertheless, the disruptive innovations deﬁnitely possess a [PAGE 1] potential to improve transport business [ 2 ]. The blockchain, as a disruptive technology and a driver of [PAGE 1] digital transformation, is projected to be the latest transformative innovation and is increasingly gaining [PAGE 1] attention from academics, practitioners, and regulators across various industries [ 3 , 4 ].

Discussion and Conclusions [PAGE 13] Although the blockchain has been one of the most discussed topics in the recent years, there is still [PAGE 13] a lack of research regarding the blockchain-based information exchange in the maritime transp ort sect or. [PAGE 13] T he aut hors have ﬁrst analysed the positive impacts of the blockchain-based information exchange [PAGE 13] in the maritime transport sector, including all three aspects of sustainability. Alth ough atte ntion [PAGE 13] is often being paid to the economic or environmental aspects of sustainability in the maritime [PAGE 13] tran sport se ctor, research has proved the importance of the blockchain-based information exchange [PAGE 13] on the social aspect of sustainability as well. The social aspect is usually related to the trust among [PAGE 13] stakeholders and data security, the reduction of human errors, the reduction of rework and recall, [PAGE 13] and enhanced jo b performanc e.
